Cricket is played between two teams of eleven players each on a field with a 22-yard pitch at the center.

Basic Equipment:
• Bat: Made of wood, maximum 38 inches long
• Ball: Leather ball, circumference 8⅞ to 9 inches
• Wickets: Three wooden stumps topped by two bails
• Protective gear: Pads, gloves, helmet

Basic Rules:
• Each team bats and bowls alternately
• The batting team tries to score runs
• The bowling team tries to dismiss batters
• Match formats vary: Test (5 days), ODI (50 overs), T20 (20 overs)

Ways to Get Out:
• Bowled: Ball hits the stumps
• Caught: Ball caught before hitting ground
• LBW (Leg Before Wicket): Ball would hit stumps but hits leg first
• Run out: Stumps broken while batsmen running
• Stumped: Wicket-keeper breaks stumps while batter out of crease
• Hit wicket: Batter accidentally hits own stumps

Scoring:
• Runs scored by running between wickets
• Boundaries: 4 runs (ball reaches boundary) or 6 runs (ball crosses boundary in air)
• Extras: Byes, leg-byes, wides, no-balls, penalties

Officials:
• Two on-field umpires make decisions
• Third umpire for video reviews
• Match referee oversees conduct
